{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3614421,"name":"","username":"nano","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/dec6dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-06T21:48:37.696Z","cooked":"

Hello,
Our team has faced troubles with Pathplanner the entire season. To be specific, the issue arises after we run the second path of the auto. Our second path either runs in the inverse direction (e.g. Instead of running back + to the left, it will go forward + to the right) or it will run in the same direction as the first path (e.g. Won’t inverse if we drive forward twice).

We have no issues running the first path, only the subsequent paths. The paths work fine alone-this issue only arises when we have more than one path in an auto.

This has severely limited our autonomous capabilities and has forced us to only run hard-coded autos. If anyone has experience with this issue or has suggestions please let us know. Thanks!

So what immediately catches my eye is that the path flipping has been configured incorrectly. WPILib establishes the blue-side origin for the field coordinate system, and this is the coordinate system that PathPlannerLib uses. When configuring the AutoBuilder, you’re meant to feed a BooleanSupplier that determines if the path should be flipped… to the red side. What your code feeds is !(alliance.get() == DriverStation.Alliance.Red), which is essentially flipping the path to the opposite side every time. However, this doesn’t quite explain what you’ve described, so I have some follow up questions that should hopefully help us get to the bottom of this.

  1. What did you base your swerve code off of?

  2. Did that code work in teleoperated mode without adding any negative signs or inverses anywhere in your code?

  3. Do the issues come from autoChooser.getSelected() or manually compiling the paths yourself?

Just to be clear, the supplier should return alliance.get() == DriverStation.Alliance.Red. The snippet I provided previously was directly from the uploaded codebase and is the opposite of what it should be.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-05-07T00:12:16.881Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":501328,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70390,"username":"nano","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/dec6dc/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto/501328/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3614777,"name":"","username":"nano","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/dec6dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-07T02:33:48.710Z","cooked":"

We use Pathplanner’s method

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-05-07T02:33:48.710Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501328,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70441,"username":"SnappleBot","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b3f665/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70390,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto/501328/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3614895,"name":"Carlos Salazar","username":"StarbuckBarista","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starbuckbarista/{size}/186251_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-07T11:39:23.944Z","cooked":"

I ran some of your auto paths in simulation, and everything on the PathPlanner end looks great (except for them flipping to the wrong side)! What that leaves us with is trying to figure out what’s wrong in the codebase that’s causing issues with following the trajectories. A lot of times, going in the wrong direction is a consequence of improper gyro readings, and I’ve noticed quite a few things in the swerve subsystem that we can improve.

Oddly, you’re using both SwerveDriveOdometry and SwerveDrivePoseEstimator since pose estimators work by maintaining their own odometry objects and “are designed to be drop-in replacements for the existing odometry classes” (WPILib Docs). So, I would recommend getting rid of the odometry object you’ve created and updating any methods to reply instead on the pose estimator. For example, instead of swerveOdometry.resetPosition(), use poseEstimator.resetPosition(). You also have both getPose() and getSwervePose(), but since getSwervePose() uses the odometry, you should get rid of it. Using getPose() in your AutoBuilder will also allow PathPlanner to get pose updates from the vision system.

The most glaring issue, however, is relying on the gyro readings to estimate the robot’s heading. For better or worse, the way the swerve ecosystem has been built makes the gyro readings relative rather than an absolute measure of the heading. Whenever you call resetPose(), rather than updating the gyro to reflect the new rotation, the pose estimator offsets every future measurement taken from the gyro. I recommend creating a new method that pulls the current heading from the pose estimator and using this new method in drive() instead of getYaw() when transforming the field relative translations to robot relative. However, it’s important that you still use getYaw() to update the pose estimator in periodic().

public Rotation2d getOdometryHeading () {

    return poseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition().getRotation();
}
","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-05-07T11:42:21.447Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":231,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":1173.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501328,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto","display_username":"Carlos Salazar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-pose-estimators.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pose Estimators — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70390,"username":"nano","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/dec6dc/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57451,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming & Electrical Captain"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto/501328/11","custom_user_title":"Programming & Electrical Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3616149,"name":"Mete Karadeniz","username":"irresistiable","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/f19dbf/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-07T19:42:56.583Z","cooked":"

We had a similar issue. We were adjusting the robot pose based on the real time calculations and applying this to do every paths end.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-05-07T19:42:56.583Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":18.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":501328,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-paths-inverting-during-auto/501328/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3625663,"name":"","username":"nano","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/dec6dc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T23:08:05.230Z","cooked":"

Sorry for the late reply, our team hasn’t had much time to meet lately. Your fix worked for not inverting the path directions, however we now face a new issue. We ran the auto again and we saw in pathplanner telemetry that the robot was following the X,Y part of the path, but not rotating. Additionally, when looking at the actual robot, the wheels do not seem to be following the path at all. We updated our code under the branch “ChiefDelphiAutos” on the GitHub. Thanks for your help
